US court blocks Florida law barring Chinese citizens from owning propertyA U.S. appeals court has blocked Florida from enforcing a ban on Chinese citizens owning homes or land in the state against two Chinese nationals who were in the process of buying property when the law was adopted. Fri, 02 Feb 2024 13:39:46 GMT R7ONJLAMRZLBVLPN57SGE3YZDM https://www.reuters.com/legal/us-court-blocks-florida-law-barring-chinese-citizens-owning-property-2024-02-02/Daniel Wiessner合法的诉讼
Exclusive: Alibaba considers sale of consumer assets including Freshippo, RT-Mart - sourcesChinese internet giant Alibaba Group is looking to sell a number of consumer sector assets, including grocery business Freshippo and retailer RT-Mart, three sources with knowledge of the situation said. Fri, 02 Feb 2024 13:04:36 GMT PMKMN5AQSZO43DB6YQJCRNY2UY https://www.reuters.com/technology/alibaba-considers-sale-of-consumer-assets-include-freshippo-rt-mart-sources-2024-02-02/Julie Zhu, Kane Wu技术
Raizen, China's BYD to build EV charging station network in BrazilSugar and ethanol firm Raizen and Chinese automaker BYD are joining forces to create a network of 600 charging stations for electric vehicles (EVs) in eight Brazilian cities, the companies said on Friday. Apple's China sales tumble highlights waning clout as local brands gainApple's weak China sales performance may have shocked investors, but customers and analysts have been noting the rising challenges the company faces in its third-largest market. Fri, 02 Feb 2024 11:09:47 GMT CUB67JJ2T5INDKEARBOU4AEOXM https://www.reuters.com/technology/apples-china-sales-tumble-highlights-waning-clout-local-brands-gain-2024-02-02/Yelin Mo, Brenda Goh技术

Pakistan military kills 24 militants in Balochistan week before electionsPakistan's military has killed 24 militants in three days in the restive southwestern province of Balochistan, the military said in a statement on Friday, less than a week before national elections. Fri, 02 Feb 2024 10:56:33 GMT SNCJCHCNGBIGXEQZK4BPHYGFRQ https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/pakistan-military-kills-24-militants-in-balochistan-week-before-elections-2024-02-02/Reuters世界亚太地区
France now backing EU AI rules, EU source says ahead of bloc endorsementFrance is now backing landmark European Union rules governing artificial intelligence subject to strict conditions, an EU diplomatic source said on Friday, after sources had previously said it was the last holdout in the bloc to support the plan. Fri, 02 Feb 2024 09:59:15 GMT URSCULKFB5MMBMCGJ6O4DVZI5I https://www.reuters.com/technology/france-now-backing-eu-ai-rules-eu-source-says-ahead-bloc-endorsement-2024-02-02/Foo Yun Chee技术被破坏
China's WuXi AppTec, Wuxi Biologics plunge to multi-year lows on fears over US biotech billShares of WuXi AppTec Co Ltd and WuXi Biologics (Cayman) tumbled on Friday as investor fears grew over a U.S. draft bill targeting Chinese biotech giants. Decline in German engineering orders eases in December - VDMAThe downward trend in German engineering companies' orders eased in December, as foreign customers helped offset weak domestic results amid ongoing uncertainty in Europe's largest economy, the VDMA association said on Friday. Fri, 02 Feb 2024 09:06:45 GMT LWXAXVAVG5MVNCEIOQO4D5Q2NM https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/decline-german-engineering-orders-eases-december-vdma-2024-02-02/Reuters市场欧洲市场
Armenia can no longer rely on Russia for military and defence needs - PM PashinyanArmenia can no longer rely on Russia as its main defence and military partner because Moscow has repeatedly let it down so Yerevan must think about forging closer ties with the United States and France, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said. Fri, 02 Feb 2024 07:18:27 GMT ZFTKQDMKEJIS5JG6HITAFKC36U https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/armenia-can-no-longer-rely-on- Russian-military-defence-needs-pm-pashinyan-says-2024-02-02/Guy Faulconbridge世界亚太地区
New China property financing measures set to be tested by banks' cautious approachChina aims to ramp up financing for home projects in the coming days as part of its support measures, but banks' reluctance to lend to the crisis-hit sector will remain a major obstacle for the distressed developers who need fresh funding the most.
